name: Deuteronomy 3:29
text: So we stayed in the valley over against Beth Peor.

name: Deuteronomy 4:1
text: Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and to the ordinances, which I teach you, to do them; that you may live, and go in and possess the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, gives you.

name: Deuteronomy 4:2
text: You shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall you diminish from it, that you may keep the commandments of Yahweh your God which I command you.

name: Deuteronomy 4:3
text: Your eyes have seen what Yahweh did because of Baal Peor; for all the men who followed Baal Peor, Yahweh your God has destroyed them from the midst of you.

name: Deuteronomy 4:4
text: But you who were faithful to Yahweh your God are all alive this day.

name: Deuteronomy 4:5
text: Behold, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, even as Yahweh my God commanded me, that you should do so in the midst of the land where you go in to possess it.

name: Deuteronomy 4:6
text: Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, who shall hear all these statutes, and say, "Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people."

name: Deuteronomy 4:7
text: For what great nation is there, that has a god so near to them, as Yahweh our God is whenever we call on him?

name: Deuteronomy 4:8
text: What great nation is there, that has statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?

name: Deuteronomy 4:9
text: Only take heed to yourself, and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things which your eyes saw, and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life; but make them known to your children and your children"s children;

name: Deuteronomy 4:10
text: the day that you stood before Yahweh your God in Horeb, when Yahweh said to me, "Assemble me the people, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children."

name: Deuteronomy 4:11
text: You came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire to the heart of the sky, with darkness, cloud, and thick darkness.

name: Deuteronomy 4:12
text: Yahweh spoke to you out of the midst of the fire: you heard the voice of words, but you saw no form; you only heard a voice.

name: Deuteronomy 4:13
text: He declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments; and he wrote them on two tables of stone.

name: Deuteronomy 4:14
text: Yahweh commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it.

name: Deuteronomy 4:15
text: Take therefore good heed to yourselves; for you saw no kind of form on the day that Yahweh spoke to you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire.

name: Deuteronomy 4:16
text: Lest you corrupt yourselves, and make yourself an engraved image in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,

name: Deuteronomy 4:17
text: the likeness of any animal that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the sky,

name: Deuteronomy 4:18
text: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth;

name: Deuteronomy 4:19
text: and lest you lift up your eyes to the sky, and when you see the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the army of the sky, you are drawn away and worship them, and serve them, which Yahweh your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole sky.

name: Deuteronomy 4:20
text: But Yahweh has taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be to him a people of inheritance, as at this day.

name: Deuteronomy 4:21
text: Furthermore Yahweh was angry with me for your sakes, and swore that I should not go over the Jordan, and that I should not go in to that good land, which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance:

name: Deuteronomy 4:22
text: but I must die in this land, I must not go over the Jordan; but you shall go over, and possess that good land.

name: Deuteronomy 4:23
text: Take heed to yourselves, lest you forget the covenant of Yahweh your God, which he made with you, and make you an engraved image in the form of anything which Yahweh your God has forbidden you.

name: Deuteronomy 4:24
text: For Yahweh your God is a devouring fire, a jealous God.

name: Deuteronomy 4:25
text: When you shall father children, and children"s children, and you shall have been long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves, and make an engraved image in the form of anything, and shall do that which is evil in the sight of Yahweh your God, to provoke him to anger;

name: Deuteronomy 4:26
text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that you shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto you go over the Jordan to possess it; you shall not prolong your days on it, but shall utterly be destroyed.

name: Deuteronomy 4:27
text: Yahweh will scatter you among the peoples, and you shall be left few in number among the nations, where Yahweh shall lead you away.

name: Deuteronomy 4:28
text: There you shall serve gods, the work of men"s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.

name: Deuteronomy 4:29
text: But from there you shall seek Yahweh your God, and you shall find him, when you search after him with all your heart and with all your soul.

name: Deuteronomy 4:30
text: When you are in oppression, and all these things have come on you, in the latter days you shall return to Yahweh your God, and listen to his voice:

name: Deuteronomy 4:31
text: for Yahweh your God is a merciful God; he will not fail you, neither destroy you, nor forget the covenant of your fathers which he swore to them.

name: Deuteronomy 4:32
text: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and from the one end of the sky to the other, whether there has been anything as this great thing is, or has been heard like it?

name: Deuteronomy 4:33
text: Did a people ever hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and live?

name: Deuteronomy 4:34
text: Or has God tried to go and take a nation for himself from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, according to all that Yahweh your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?

name: Deuteronomy 4:35
text: It was shown to you so that you might know that Yahweh is God. There is no one else besides him.

name: Deuteronomy 4:36
text: Out of heaven he made you to hear his voice, that he might instruct you: and on earth he made you to see his great fire; and you heard his words out of the midst of the fire.

name: Deuteronomy 4:37
text: Because he loved your fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought you out with his presence, with his great power, out of Egypt;

name: Deuteronomy 4:38
text: to drive out nations from before you greater and mightier than you, to bring you in, to give you their land for an inheritance, as at this day.

name: Deuteronomy 4:39
text: Know therefore this day, and lay it to your heart, that Yahweh he is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath; there is none else.

name: Deuteronomy 4:40
text: You shall keep his statutes, and his commandments, which I command you this day, that it may go well with you, and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land, which Yahweh your God gives you, forever.

name: Deuteronomy 4:41
text: Then Moses set apart three cities beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise;

name: Deuteronomy 4:42
text: that the manslayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unawares, and didn"t hate him in time past; and that fleeing to one of these cities he might live:

name: Deuteronomy 4:43
text: Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.

name: Deuteronomy 4:44
text: This is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:

name: Deuteronomy 4:45
text: these are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which Moses spoke to the children of Israel, when they came forth out of Egypt,

name: Deuteronomy 4:46
text: beyond the Jordan, in the valley over against Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel struck, when they came forth out of Egypt.

name: Deuteronomy 4:47
text: They took his land in possession, and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise;

name: Deuteronomy 4:48
text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, even to Mount Sion (the same is Hermon),

name: Deuteronomy 4:49
text: and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even to the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.

name: Deuteronomy 5:1
text: Moses called to all Israel, and said to them, Hear, Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in your ears this day, that you may learn them, and observe to do them.

name: Deuteronomy 5:2
text: Yahweh our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.

name: Deuteronomy 5:3
text: Yahweh didn"t make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, even us, who are all of us here alive this day.

name: Deuteronomy 5:4
text: Yahweh spoke with you face to face on the mountain out of the midst of the fire,

name: Deuteronomy 5:5
text: (I stood between Yahweh and you at that time, to show you the word of Yahweh: for you were afraid because of the fire, and didn"t go up onto the mountain;) saying,

name: Deuteronomy 5:6
text: "I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

name: Deuteronomy 5:7
text: "You shall have no other gods before me.

name: Deuteronomy 5:8
text: "You shall not make an engraved image for yourself, any likeness of what is in heaven above, or what is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:

name: Deuteronomy 5:9
text: you shall not bow down yourself to them, nor serve them; for I, Yahweh, your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, and on the third and on the fourth generation of those who hate me;

name: Deuteronomy 5:10
text: and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.

name: Deuteronomy 5:11
text: "You shall not take the name of Yahweh your God in vain: for Yahweh will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.

name: Deuteronomy 5:12
text: "Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as Yahweh your God commanded you.

name: Deuteronomy 5:13
text: You shall labor six days, and do all your work;

name: Deuteronomy 5:14
text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to Yahweh your God, in which you shall not do any work, you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your livestock, nor your stranger who is within your gates; that your male servant and your female servant may rest as well as you.

name: Deuteronomy 5:15
text: You shall remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore Yahweh your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.

name: Deuteronomy 5:16
text: "Honor your father and your mother, as Yahweh your God commanded you; that your days may be long, and that it may go well with you, in the land which Yahweh your God gives you.

name: Deuteronomy 5:17
text: "You shall not murder.

name: Deuteronomy 5:18
text: "Neither shall you commit adultery.

name: Deuteronomy 5:19
text: "Neither shall you steal.

name: Deuteronomy 5:20
text: "Neither shall you give false testimony against your neighbor.

name: Deuteronomy 5:21
text: "Neither shall you covet your neighbor"s wife; neither shall you desire your neighbor"s house, his field, or his male servant, or his female servant, his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor"s."

name: Deuteronomy 5:22
text: These words Yahweh spoke to all your assembly on the mountain out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness, with a great voice: and he added no more. He wrote them on two tables of stone, and gave them to me.

name: Deuteronomy 5:23
text: It happened, when you heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, that you came near to me, even all the heads of your tribes, and your elders;

name: Deuteronomy 5:24
text: and you said, "Behold, Yahweh our God has shown us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire: we have seen this day that God does speak with man, and he lives.

name: Deuteronomy 5:25
text: Now therefore why should we die? For this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of Yahweh our God any more, then we shall die.

name: Deuteronomy 5:26
text: For who is there of all flesh, that has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?

name: Deuteronomy 5:27
text: Go near, and hear all that Yahweh our God shall say: and tell us all that Yahweh our God shall tell you; and we will hear it, and do it."

name: Deuteronomy 5:28
text: Yahweh heard the voice of your words, when you spoke to me; and Yahweh said to me, "I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken to you: they have well said all that they have spoken.

name: Deuteronomy 5:29
text: Oh that there were such a heart in them, that they would fear me, and keep all my commandments always, that it might be well with them, and with their children forever!

name: Deuteronomy 5:30
text: "Go tell them, Return to your tents.

name: Deuteronomy 5:31
text: But as for you, stand here by me, and I will tell you all the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which you shall teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it."

name: Deuteronomy 5:32
text: You shall observe to do therefore as Yahweh your God has commanded you: you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.

name: Deuteronomy 5:33
text: You shall walk in all the way which Yahweh your God has commanded you, that you may live, and that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you shall possess.

name: Deuteronomy 6:1
text: Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh your God commanded to teach you, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it;

name: Deuteronomy 6:2
text: that you might fear Yahweh your God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command you, you, and your son, and your son"s son, all the days of your life; and that your days may be prolonged.

name: Deuteronomy 6:3
text: Hear therefore, Israel, and observe to do it; that it may be well with you, and that you may increase mightily, as Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has promised to you, in a land flowing with milk and honey.

name: Deuteronomy 6:4
text: Hear, Israel: Yahweh is our God; Yahweh is one:

name: Deuteronomy 6:5
text: and you shall love Yahweh your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your might.

name: Deuteronomy 6:6
text: These words, which I command you this day, shall be on your heart;

name: Deuteronomy 6:7
text: and you shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up.

name: Deuteronomy 6:8
text: You shall bind them for a sign on your hand, and they shall be for symbols between your eyes.

name: Deuteronomy 6:9
text: You shall write them on the door posts of your house, and on your gates.

name: Deuteronomy 6:10
text: It shall be, when Yahweh your God shall bring you into the land which he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give you, great and goodly cities, which you didn"t build,

name: Deuteronomy 6:11
text: and houses full of all good things, which you didn"t fill, and cisterns dug out, which you didn"t dig, vineyards and olive trees, which you didn"t plant, and you shall eat and be full;

name: Deuteronomy 6:12
text: then beware lest you forget Yahweh, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

name: Deuteronomy 6:13
text: You shall fear Yahweh your God; and you shall serve him, and shall swear by his name.

name: Deuteronomy 6:14
text: You shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples who are around you;

name: Deuteronomy 6:15
text: for Yahweh your God in the midst of you is a jealous God; lest the anger of Yahweh your God be kindled against you, and he destroy you from off the face of the earth.

name: Deuteronomy 6:16
text: You shall not tempt Yahweh your God, as you tempted him in Massah.

name: Deuteronomy 6:17
text: You shall diligently keep the commandments of Yahweh your God, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he has commanded you.

name: Deuteronomy 6:18
text: You shall do that which is right and good in the sight of Yahweh; that it may be well with you, and that you may go in and possess the good land which Yahweh swore to your fathers,

name: Deuteronomy 6:19
text: to thrust out all your enemies from before you, as Yahweh has spoken.

name: Deuteronomy 6:20
text: When your son asks you in time to come, saying, "What do the testimonies, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh our God has commanded you mean?"

name: Deuteronomy 6:21
text: then you shall tell your son, "We were Pharaoh"s bondservants in Egypt: and Yahweh brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand;

name: Deuteronomy 6:22
text: and Yahweh showed great and awesome signs and wonders on Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on all his house, before our eyes;

name: Deuteronomy 6:23
text: and he brought us out from there, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he swore to our fathers.

name: Deuteronomy 6:24
text: Yahweh commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear Yahweh our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as at this day.

name: Deuteronomy 6:25
text: It shall be righteousness to us, if we observe to do all this commandment before Yahweh our God, as he has commanded us."

name: Deuteronomy 7:1
text: When Yahweh your God shall bring you into the land where you go to possess it, and shall cast out many nations before you, the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, seven nations greater and mightier than you;

name: Deuteronomy 7:2
text: and when Yahweh your God shall deliver them up before you, and you shall strike them; then you shall utterly destroy them: you shall make no covenant with them, nor show mercy to them;

name: Deuteronomy 7:3
text: neither shall you make marriages with them; your daughter you shall not give to his son, nor shall you take his daughter for your son.

name: Deuteronomy 7:4
text: For he will turn away your son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so the anger of Yahweh would be kindled against you, and he would destroy you quickly.

name: Deuteronomy 7:5
text: But you shall deal with them like this: you shall break down their altars, and dash their pillars in pieces, and cut down their Asherim, and burn their engraved images with fire.

name: Deuteronomy 7:6
text: For you are a holy people to Yahweh your God: Yahweh your God has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.

name: Deuteronomy 7:7
text: Yahweh didn"t set his love on you, nor choose you, because you were more in number than any people; for you were the fewest of all peoples:

name: Deuteronomy 7:8
text: but because Yahweh loves you, and because he would keep the oath which he swore to your fathers, has Yahweh brought you out with a mighty hand, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.

name: Deuteronomy 7:9
text: Know therefore that Yahweh your God, he is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with them who love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations,

name: Deuteronomy 7:10
text: and repays those who hate him to their face, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him who hates him, he will repay him to his face.

name: Deuteronomy 7:11
text: You shall therefore keep the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which I command you this day, to do them.

name: Deuteronomy 7:12
text: It shall happen, because you listen to these ordinances, and keep and do them, that Yahweh your God will keep with you the covenant and the loving kindness which he swore to your fathers:

name: Deuteronomy 7:13
text: and he will love you, and bless you, and multiply you; he will also bless the fruit of your body and the fruit of your ground, your grain and your new wine and your oil, the increase of your livestock and the young of your flock, in the land which he swore to your fathers to give you.

name: Deuteronomy 7:14
text: You shall be blessed above all peoples: there shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your livestock.

name: Deuteronomy 7:15
text: Yahweh will take away from you all sickness; and none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which you know, he will put on you, but will lay them on all those who hate you.

name: Deuteronomy 7:16
text: You shall consume all the peoples whom Yahweh your God shall deliver to you; your eye shall not pity them: neither shall you serve their gods; for that will be a snare to you.

name: Deuteronomy 7:17
text: If you shall say in your heart, "These nations are more than I; how can I dispossess them?"

name: Deuteronomy 7:18
text: you shall not be afraid of them: you shall well remember what Yahweh your God did to Pharaoh, and to all Egypt;

name: Deuteronomy 7:19
text: the great trials which your eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm, by which Yahweh your God brought you out: so shall Yahweh your God do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.

name: Deuteronomy 7:20
text: Moreover Yahweh your God will send the hornet among them, until those who are left, and hide themselves, perish from before you.

name: Deuteronomy 7:21
text: You shall not be scared of them; for Yahweh your God is in the midst of you, a great and awesome God.

name: Deuteronomy 7:22
text: Yahweh your God will cast out those nations before you by little and little: you may not consume them at once, lest the animals of the field increase on you.

name: Deuteronomy 7:23
text: But Yahweh your God will deliver them up before you, and will confuse them with a great confusion, until they be destroyed.

name: Deuteronomy 7:24
text: He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall make their name to perish from under the sky: no man shall be able to stand before you, until you have destroyed them.

name: Deuteronomy 7:25
text: You shall burn the engraved images of their gods with fire. You shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it for yourself, lest you be snared in it; for it is an abomination to Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 7:26
text: You shall not bring an abomination into your house, and become a devoted thing like it. You shall utterly detest it, and you shall utterly abhor it; for it is a devoted thing.

name: Deuteronomy 8:1
text: You shall observe to do all the commandment which I command you this day, that you may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers.

name: Deuteronomy 8:2
text: You shall remember all the way which Yahweh your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, that he might humble you, to prove you, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep his commandments, or not.

name: Deuteronomy 8:3
text: He humbled you, and allowed you to be hungry, and fed you with manna, which you didn"t know, neither did your fathers know; that he might make you know that man does not live by bread only, but man lives by everything that proceeds out of the mouth of Yahweh.

name: Deuteronomy 8:4
text: Your clothing didn"t grow old on you, neither did your foot swell, these forty years.

name: Deuteronomy 8:5
text: You shall consider in your heart that as a man chastens his son, so Yahweh your God chastens you.

name: Deuteronomy 8:6
text: You shall keep the commandments of Yahweh your God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him.

name: Deuteronomy 8:7
text: For Yahweh your God brings you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of springs, and underground water flowing into valleys and hills;

name: Deuteronomy 8:8
text: a land of wheat and barley, and vines and fig trees and pomegranates; a land of olive trees and honey;

name: Deuteronomy 8:9
text: a land in which you shall eat bread without scarceness, you shall not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper.

name: Deuteronomy 8:10
text: You shall eat and be full, and you shall bless Yahweh your God for the good land which he has given you.

name: Deuteronomy 8:11
text: Beware lest you forget Yahweh your God, in not keeping his commandments, and his ordinances, and his statutes, which I command you this day:

name: Deuteronomy 8:12
text: lest, when you have eaten and are full, and have built goodly houses, and lived therein;

name: Deuteronomy 8:13
text: and when your herds and your flocks multiply, and your silver and your gold is multiplied, and all that you have is multiplied;

name: Deuteronomy 8:14
text: then your heart be lifted up, and you forget Yahweh your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage;

name: Deuteronomy 8:15
text: who led you through the great and terrible wilderness, with fiery serpents and scorpions, and thirsty ground where there was no water; who brought you forth water out of the rock of flint;

name: Deuteronomy 8:16
text: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers didn"t know; that he might humble you, and that he might prove you, to do you good at your latter end:

name: Deuteronomy 8:17
text: and lest you say in your heart, "My power and the might of my hand has gotten me this wealth."

name: Deuteronomy 8:18
text: But you shall remember Yahweh your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth; that he may establish his covenant which he swore to your fathers, as at this day.

name: Deuteronomy 8:19
text: It shall be, if you shall forget Yahweh your God, and walk after other gods, and serve them, and worship them, I testify against you this day that you shall surely perish.

name: Deuteronomy 8:20
text: As the nations that Yahweh makes to perish before you, so you shall perish; because you wouldn"t listen to the voice of Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 9:1
text: Hear, Israel: you are to pass over the Jordan this day, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourself, cities great and fortified up to the sky,

name: Deuteronomy 9:2
text: a people great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom you know, and of whom you have heard say, "Who can stand before the sons of Anak?"

name: Deuteronomy 9:3
text: Know therefore this day, that Yahweh your God is he who goes over before you as a devouring fire; he will destroy them, and he will bring them down before you: so you shall drive them out, and make them to perish quickly, as Yahweh has spoken to you.

name: Deuteronomy 9:4
text: Don"t say in your heart, after Yahweh your God has thrust them out from before you, saying, "For my righteousness Yahweh has brought me in to possess this land;" because Yahweh drives them out before you because of the wickedness of these nations.

name: Deuteronomy 9:5
text: Not for your righteousness, or for the uprightness of your heart, do you go in to possess their land; but for the wickedness of these nations Yahweh your God does drive them out from before you, and that he may establish the word which Yahweh swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

name: Deuteronomy 9:6
text: Know therefore, that Yahweh your God doesn"t give you this good land to possess it for your righteousness; for you are a stiff-necked people.

name: Deuteronomy 9:7
text: Remember, don"t forget, how you provoked Yahweh your God to wrath in the wilderness: from the day that you went forth out of the land of Egypt, until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against Yahweh.

name: Deuteronomy 9:8
text: Also in Horeb you provoked Yahweh to wrath, and Yahweh was angry with you to destroy you.

name: Deuteronomy 9:9
text: When I was gone up onto the mountain to receive the tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant which Yahweh made with you, then I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water.

name: Deuteronomy 9:10
text: Yahweh delivered to me the two tables of stone written with the finger of God; and on them were all the words which Yahweh spoke with you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.

name: Deuteronomy 9:11
text: It came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights, that Yahweh gave me the two tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant.

name: Deuteronomy 9:12
text: Yahweh said to me, "Arise, get down quickly from here; for your people whom you have brought out of Egypt have corrupted themselves; they have quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made them a molten image."

name: Deuteronomy 9:13
text: Furthermore Yahweh spoke to me, saying, "I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people:

name: Deuteronomy 9:14
text: let me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under the sky; and I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they."

name: Deuteronomy 9:15
text: So I turned and came down from the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire: and the two tables of the covenant were in my two hands.

name: Deuteronomy 9:16
text: I looked, and behold, you had sinned against Yahweh your God; you had made yourselves a molten calf: you had turned aside quickly out of the way which Yahweh had commanded you.

name: Deuteronomy 9:17
text: I took hold of the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and broke them before your eyes.

name: Deuteronomy 9:18
text: I fell down before Yahweh, as at the first, forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water; because of all your sin which you sinned, in doing that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, to provoke him to anger.

name: Deuteronomy 9:19
text: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, with which Yahweh was angry against you to destroy you. But Yahweh listened to me that time also.

name: Deuteronomy 9:20
text: Yahweh was very angry with Aaron to destroy him: and I prayed for Aaron also at the same time.

name: Deuteronomy 9:21
text: I took your sin, the calf which you had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, grinding it very small, until it was as fine as dust: and I cast its dust into the brook that descended out of the mountain.

name: Deuteronomy 9:22
text: At Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth Hattaavah, you provoked Yahweh to wrath.

name: Deuteronomy 9:23
text: When Yahweh sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, "Go up and possess the land which I have given you;" then you rebelled against the commandment of Yahweh your God, and you didn"t believe him, nor listen to his voice.

name: Deuteronomy 9:24
text: You have been rebellious against Yahweh from the day that I knew you.

name: Deuteronomy 9:25
text: So I fell down before Yahweh the forty days and forty nights that I fell down, because Yahweh had said he would destroy you.

name: Deuteronomy 9:26
text: I prayed to Yahweh, and said, "Lord Yahweh, don"t destroy your people and your inheritance, that you have redeemed through your greatness, that you have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.

name: Deuteronomy 9:27
text: Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; don"t look to the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin,

name: Deuteronomy 9:28
text: lest the land you brought us out from say, "Because Yahweh was not able to bring them into the land which he promised to them, and because he hated them, he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness."

name: Deuteronomy 9:29
text: Yet they are your people and your inheritance, which you brought out by your great power and by your outstretched arm."

name: Deuteronomy 10:1
text: At that time Yahweh said to me, "Cut two tables of stone like the first, and come up to me onto the mountain, and make an ark of wood.

name: Deuteronomy 10:2
text: I will write on the tables the words that were on the first tables which you broke, and you shall put them in the ark."

name: Deuteronomy 10:3
text: So I made an ark of acacia wood, and cut two tables of stone like the first, and went up onto the mountain, having the two tables in my hand.

name: Deuteronomy 10:4
text: He wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which Yahweh spoke to you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and Yahweh gave them to me.

name: Deuteronomy 10:5
text: I turned and came down from the mountain, and put the tables in the ark which I had made; and there they are as Yahweh commanded me.

name: Deuteronomy 10:6
text: (The children of Israel traveled from Beeroth Bene Jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest"s office in his place.

name: Deuteronomy 10:7
text: From there they traveled to Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of brooks of water.

name: Deuteronomy 10:8
text: At that time Yahweh set apart the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, to stand before Yahweh to minister to him, and to bless in his name, to this day.

name: Deuteronomy 10:9
text: Therefore Levi has no portion nor inheritance with his brothers; Yahweh is his inheritance, according as Yahweh your God spoke to him.)

name: Deuteronomy 10:10
text: I stayed on the mountain, as at the first time, forty days and forty nights: and Yahweh listened to me that time also; Yahweh would not destroy you.

name: Deuteronomy 10:11
text: Yahweh said to me, "Arise, take your journey before the people; and they shall go in and possess the land, which I swore to their fathers to give to them."

name: Deuteronomy 10:12
text: Now, Israel, what does Yahweh your God require of you, but to fear Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul,

name: Deuteronomy 10:13
text: to keep the commandments of Yahweh, and his statutes, which I command you this day for your good?

name: Deuteronomy 10:14
text: Behold, to Yahweh your God belongs heaven and the heaven of heavens, the earth, with all that is therein.

name: Deuteronomy 10:15
text: Only Yahweh had a delight in your fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all peoples, as at this day.

name: Deuteronomy 10:16
text: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiff-necked.

name: Deuteronomy 10:17
text: For Yahweh your God, he is God of gods, and Lord of lords, the great God, the mighty, and the awesome, who doesn"t respect persons, nor takes reward.

name: Deuteronomy 10:18
text: He does execute justice for the fatherless and widow, and loves the foreigner, in giving him food and clothing.

name: Deuteronomy 10:19
text: Therefore love the foreigner; for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.

name: Deuteronomy 10:20
text: You shall fear Yahweh your God; you shall serve him; and you shall cling to him, and you shall swear by his name.

name: Deuteronomy 10:21
text: He is your praise, and he is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome things, which your eyes have seen.

name: Deuteronomy 10:22
text: Your fathers went down into Egypt with seventy persons; and now Yahweh your God has made you as the stars of the sky for multitude.

name: Deuteronomy 11:1
text: Therefore you shall love Yahweh your God, and keep his instructions, and his statutes, and his ordinances, and his commandments, always.

name: Deuteronomy 11:2
text: Know this day: for I don"t speak with your children who have not known, and who have not seen the chastisement of Yahweh your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm,

name: Deuteronomy 11:3
text: and his signs, and his works, which he did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh the king of Egypt, and to all his land;

name: Deuteronomy 11:4
text: and what he did to the army of Egypt, to their horses, and to their chariots; how he made the water of the Red Sea to overflow them as they pursued after you, and how Yahweh has destroyed them to this day;

name: Deuteronomy 11:5
text: and what he did to you in the wilderness, until you came to this place;

name: Deuteronomy 11:6
text: and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben; how the earth opened its mouth, and swallowed them up, and their households, and their tents, and every living thing that followed them, in the midst of all Israel:

name: Deuteronomy 11:7
text: but your eyes have seen all the great work of Yahweh which he did.

name: Deuteronomy 11:8
text: Therefore you shall keep all the commandment which I command you this day, that you may be strong, and go in and possess the land, where you go over to possess it;

name: Deuteronomy 11:9
text: and that you may prolong your days in the land, which Yahweh swore to your fathers to give to them and to their seed, a land flowing with milk and honey.

name: Deuteronomy 11:10
text: For the land, where you go in to possess it, isn"t as the land of Egypt, that you came out from, where you sowed your seed, and watered it with your foot, as a garden of herbs;

name: Deuteronomy 11:11
text: but the land, where you go over to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys which drinks water of the rain of the sky,

name: Deuteronomy 11:12
text: a land which Yahweh your God cares for: the eyes of Yahweh your God are always on it, from the beginning of the year even to the end of the year.

name: Deuteronomy 11:13
text: It shall happen, if you shall listen diligently to my commandments which I command you this day, to love Yahweh your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,

name: Deuteronomy 11:14
text: that I will give the rain of your land in its season, the former rain and the latter rain, that you may gather in your grain, and your new wine, and your oil.

name: Deuteronomy 11:15
text: I will give grass in your fields for your livestock, and you shall eat and be full.

name: Deuteronomy 11:16
text: Take heed to yourselves, lest your heart be deceived, and you turn aside, and serve other gods, and worship them;

name: Deuteronomy 11:17
text: and the anger of Yahweh be kindled against you, and he shut up the sky, so that there shall be no rain, and the land shall not yield its fruit; and you perish quickly from off the good land which Yahweh gives you.

name: Deuteronomy 11:18
text: Therefore you shall lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul; and you shall bind them for a sign on your hand, and they shall be for symbols between your eyes.

name: Deuteronomy 11:19
text: You shall teach them your children, talking of them, when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up.

name: Deuteronomy 11:20
text: You shall write them on the door posts of your house, and on your gates;

name: Deuteronomy 11:21
text: that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, in the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers to give them, as the days of the heavens above the earth.

name: Deuteronomy 11:22
text: For if you shall diligently keep all this commandment which I command you, to do it, to love Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, and to cling to him;

name: Deuteronomy 11:23
text: then will Yahweh drive out all these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourselves.

name: Deuteronomy 11:24
text: Every place whereon the sole of your foot shall tread shall be yours: from the wilderness, and Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, even to the hinder sea shall be your border.

name: Deuteronomy 11:25
text: No man shall be able to stand before you: Yahweh your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you on all the land that you shall tread on, as he has spoken to you.

name: Deuteronomy 11:26
text: Behold, I set before you this day a blessing and a curse:

name: Deuteronomy 11:27
text: the blessing, if you shall listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God, which I command you this day;

name: Deuteronomy 11:28
text: and the curse, if you shall not listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you this day, to go after other gods, which you have not known.

name: Deuteronomy 11:29
text: It shall happen, when Yahweh your God shall bring you into the land where you go to possess it, that you shall set the blessing on Mount Gerizim, and the curse on Mount Ebal.

name: Deuteronomy 11:30
text: Aren"t they beyond the Jordan, behind the way of the going down of the sun, in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah, over against Gilgal, beside the oaks of Moreh?

name: Deuteronomy 11:31
text: For you are to pass over the Jordan to go in to possess the land which Yahweh your God gives you, and you shall possess it, and dwell therein.

name: Deuteronomy 11:32
text: You shall observe to do all the statutes and the ordinances which I set before you this day.

name: Deuteronomy 12:1
text: These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess it, all the days that you live on the earth.

name: Deuteronomy 12:2
text: You shall surely destroy all the places in which the nations that you shall dispossess served their gods, on the high mountains, and on the hills, and under every green tree:

name: Deuteronomy 12:3
text: and you shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and burn their Asherim with fire; and you shall cut down the engraved images of their gods; and you shall destroy their name out of that place.

name: Deuteronomy 12:4
text: You shall not do so to Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 12:5
text: But to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose out of all your tribes, to put his name there, even to his habitation you shall seek, and there you shall come;

name: Deuteronomy 12:6
text: and there you shall bring your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, and your tithes, and the wave offering of your hand, and your vows, and your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock:

name: Deuteronomy 12:7
text: and there you shall eat before Yahweh your God, and you shall rejoice in all that you put your hand to, you and your households, in which Yahweh your God has blessed you.

name: Deuteronomy 12:8
text: You shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatever is right in his own eyes;

name: Deuteronomy 12:9
text: for you haven"t yet come to the rest and to the inheritance, which Yahweh your God gives you.

name: Deuteronomy 12:10
text: But when you go over the Jordan, and dwell in the land which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, and he gives you rest from all your enemies around you, so that you dwell in safety;

name: Deuteronomy 12:11
text: then it shall happen that to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there, there you shall bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, your tithes, and the wave offering of your hand, and all your choice vows which you vow to Yahweh.

name: Deuteronomy 12:12
text: You shall rejoice before Yahweh your God, you, and your sons, and your daughters, and your male servants, and your female servants, and the Levite who is within your gates, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you.

name: Deuteronomy 12:13
text: Take heed to yourself that you don"t offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see;

name: Deuteronomy 12:14
text: but in the place which Yahweh shall choose in one of your tribes, there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all that I command you.

name: Deuteronomy 12:15
text: Notwithstanding, you may kill and eat flesh within all your gates, after all the desire of your soul, according to the blessing of Yahweh your God which he has given you: the unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle, and as of the hart.

name: Deuteronomy 12:16
text: Only you shall not eat the blood; you shall pour it out on the earth as water.

name: Deuteronomy 12:17
text: You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, or of your new wine, or of your oil, or the firstborn of your herd or of your flock, nor any of your vows which you vow, nor your freewill offerings, nor the wave offering of your hand;

name: Deuteronomy 12:18
text: but you shall eat them before Yahweh your God in the place which Yahweh your God shall choose, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates: and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God in all that you put your hand to.

name: Deuteronomy 12:19
text: Take heed to yourself that you don"t forsake the Levite as long as you live in your land.

name: Deuteronomy 12:20
text: When Yahweh your God shall enlarge your border, as he has promised you, and you shall say, "I want to eat meat," because your soul desires to eat meat; you may eat meat, after all the desire of your soul.

name: Deuteronomy 12:21
text: If the place which Yahweh your God shall choose, to put his name there, is too far from you, then you shall kill of your herd and of your flock, which Yahweh has given you, as I have commanded you; and you may eat within your gates, after all the desire of your soul.

name: Deuteronomy 12:22
text: Even as the gazelle and as the hart is eaten, so you shall eat of it: the unclean and the clean may eat of it alike.

name: Deuteronomy 12:23
text: Only be sure that you don"t eat the blood: for the blood is the life; and you shall not eat the life with the flesh.

name: Deuteronomy 12:24
text: You shall not eat it; you shall pour it out on the earth as water.

name: Deuteronomy 12:25
text: You shall not eat it; that it may go well with you, and with your children after you, when you shall do that which is right in the eyes of Yahweh.

name: Deuteronomy 12:26
text: Only your holy things which you have, and your vows, you shall take, and go to the place which Yahweh shall choose:

name: Deuteronomy 12:27
text: and you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, on the altar of Yahweh your God; and the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out on the altar of Yahweh your God; and you shall eat the flesh.

name: Deuteronomy 12:28
text: Observe and hear all these words which I command you, that it may go well with you, and with your children after you forever, when you do that which is good and right in the eyes of Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 12:29
text: When Yahweh your God shall cut off the nations from before you, where you go in to dispossess them, and you dispossess them, and dwell in their land;

name: Deuteronomy 12:30
text: take heed to yourself that you not be ensnared to follow them, after that they are destroyed from before you; and that you not inquire after their gods, saying, "How do these nations serve their gods? I will do likewise."

name: Deuteronomy 12:31
text: You shall not do so to Yahweh your God: for every abomination to Yahweh, which he hates, have they done to their gods; for even their sons and their daughters do they burn in the fire to their gods.

name: Deuteronomy 12:32
text: Whatever thing I command you, that you shall observe to do: you shall not add thereto, nor diminish from it.

name: Deuteronomy 13:1
text: If there arise in the midst of you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and he give you a sign or a wonder,

name: Deuteronomy 13:2
text: and the sign or the wonder come to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, "Let us go after other gods" (which you have not known) "and let us serve them;"

name: Deuteronomy 13:3
text: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet, or to that dreamer of dreams: for Yahweh your God proves you, to know whether you love Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul.

name: Deuteronomy 13:4
text: You shall walk after Yahweh your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice, and you shall serve him, and cling to him.

name: Deuteronomy 13:5
text: That prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death, because he has spoken rebellion against Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to draw you aside out of the way which Yahweh your God commanded you to walk in. So you shall put away the evil from the midst of you.

name: Deuteronomy 13:6
text: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son, or your daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your friend, who is as your own soul, entice you secretly, saying, "Let us go and serve other gods," which you have not known, you, nor your fathers;

name: Deuteronomy 13:7
text: of the gods of the peoples who are around you, near to you, or far off from you, from the one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth;

name: Deuteronomy 13:8
text: you shall not consent to him, nor listen to him; neither shall your eye pity him, neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him:

name: Deuteronomy 13:9
text: but you shall surely kill him; your hand shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people.

name: Deuteronomy 13:10
text: You shall stone him to death with stones, because he has sought to draw you away from Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

name: Deuteronomy 13:11
text: All Israel shall hear, and fear, and shall not do any more such wickedness as this is in the midst of you.

name: Deuteronomy 13:12
text: If you shall hear tell concerning one of your cities, which Yahweh your God gives you to dwell there, saying,

name: Deuteronomy 13:13
text: Certain base fellows are gone out from the midst of you, and have drawn away the inhabitants of their city, saying, "Let us go and serve other gods," which you have not known;

name: Deuteronomy 13:14
text: then you shall inquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and, behold, if it be truth, and the thing certain, that such abomination is done in the midst of you,

name: Deuteronomy 13:15
text: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein and its livestock, with the edge of the sword.

name: Deuteronomy 13:16
text: You shall gather all its spoil into the midst of its street, and shall burn with fire the city, and all its spoil every whit, to Yahweh your God: and it shall be a heap forever; it shall not be built again.

name: Deuteronomy 13:17
text: Nothing of the devoted thing shall cling to your hand; that Yahweh may turn from the fierceness of his anger, and show you mercy, and have compassion on you, and multiply you, as he has sworn to your fathers;

name: Deuteronomy 13:18
text: when you shall listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to keep all his commandments which I command you this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 14:1
text: You are the children of Yahweh your God: you shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.

name: Deuteronomy 14:2
text: For you are a holy people to Yahweh your God, and Yahweh has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.

name: Deuteronomy 14:3
text: You shall not eat any abominable thing.

name: Deuteronomy 14:4
text: These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,

name: Deuteronomy 14:5
text: the hart, and the gazelle, and the roebuck, and the wild goat, and the ibex, and the antelope, and the chamois.

name: Deuteronomy 14:6
text: Every animal that parts the hoof, and has the hoof cloven in two and chews the cud, among the animals, that may you eat.

name: Deuteronomy 14:7
text: Nevertheless these you shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or of those who have the hoof cloven: the camel, and the hare, and the rabbit; because they chew the cud but don"t part the hoof, they are unclean to you.

name: Deuteronomy 14:8
text: The pig, because it has a split hoof but doesn"t chew the cud, is unclean to you: of their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch.

name: Deuteronomy 14:9
text: These you may eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales may you eat;

name: Deuteronomy 14:10
text: and whatever doesn"t have fins and scales you shall not eat; it is unclean to you.

name: Deuteronomy 14:11
text: Of all clean birds you may eat.

name: Deuteronomy 14:12
text: But these are they of which you shall not eat: the eagle, and the vulture, and the osprey,

name: Deuteronomy 14:13
text: and the red kite, and the falcon, and the kite after its kind,

name: Deuteronomy 14:14
text: and every raven after its kind,

name: Deuteronomy 14:15
text: and the ostrich, and the owl, and the seagull, and the hawk after its kind,

name: Deuteronomy 14:16
text: the little owl, and the great owl, and the horned owl,

name: Deuteronomy 14:17
text: and the pelican, and the vulture, and the cormorant,

name: Deuteronomy 14:18
text: and the stork, and the heron after its kind, and the hoopoe, and the bat.

name: Deuteronomy 14:19
text: All winged creeping things are unclean to you: they shall not be eaten.

name: Deuteronomy 14:20
text: Of all clean birds you may eat.

name: Deuteronomy 14:21
text: You shall not eat of anything that dies of itself: you may give it to the foreigner living among you who is within your gates, that he may eat it; or you may sell it to a foreigner: for you are a holy people to Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother"s milk.

name: Deuteronomy 14:22
text: You shall surely tithe all the increase of your seed, that which comes forth from the field year by year.

name: Deuteronomy 14:23
text: You shall eat before Yahweh your God, in the place which he shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there, the tithe of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock; that you may learn to fear Yahweh your God always.

name: Deuteronomy 14:24
text: If the way is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry it, because the place is too far from you, which Yahweh your God shall choose, to set his name there, when Yahweh your God shall bless you;

name: Deuteronomy 14:25
text: then you shall turn it into money, and bind up the money in your hand, and shall go to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose:

name: Deuteronomy 14:26
text: and you shall bestow the money for whatever your soul desires, for cattle, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatever your soul asks of you; and you shall eat there before Yahweh your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your household.

name: Deuteronomy 14:27
text: The Levite who is within your gates, you shall not forsake him; for he has no portion nor inheritance with you.

name: Deuteronomy 14:28
text: At the end of every three years you shall bring forth all the tithe of your increase in the same year, and shall lay it up within your gates:

name: Deuteronomy 14:29
text: and the Levite, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you, and the foreigner living among you, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that Yahweh your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.

name: Deuteronomy 15:1
text: At the end of every seven years you shall make a release.

name: Deuteronomy 15:2
text: This is the way of the release: every creditor shall release that which he has lent to his neighbor; he shall not exact it of his neighbor and his brother; because Yahweh"s release has been proclaimed.

name: Deuteronomy 15:3
text: Of a foreigner you may exact it: but whatever of your is with your brother your hand shall release.

name: Deuteronomy 15:4
text: However there shall be no poor with you; (for Yahweh will surely bless you in the land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance to possess it;)

name: Deuteronomy 15:5
text: if only you diligently listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to observe to do all this commandment which I command you this day.

name: Deuteronomy 15:6
text: For Yahweh your God will bless you, as he promised you: and you shall lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow; and you shall rule over many nations, but they shall not rule over you.

name: Deuteronomy 15:7
text: If a poor man, one of your brothers, is with you within any of your gates in your land which Yahweh your God gives you, you shall not harden your heart, nor shut your hand from your poor brother;

name: Deuteronomy 15:8
text: but you shall surely open your hand to him, and shall surely lend him sufficient for his need, which he lacks.

name: Deuteronomy 15:9
text: Beware that there not be a base thought in your heart, saying, "The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand;" and your eye be evil against your poor brother, and you give him nothing; and he cry to Yahweh against you, and it be sin to you.

name: Deuteronomy 15:10
text: You shall surely give him, and your heart shall not be grieved when you give to him; because that for this thing Yahweh your God will bless you in all your work, and in all that you put your hand to.

name: Deuteronomy 15:11
text: For the poor will never cease out of the land: therefore I command you, saying, You shall surely open your hand to your brother, to your needy, and to your poor, in your land.

name: Deuteronomy 15:12
text: If your brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold to you, and serves you six years; then in the seventh year you shall let him go free from you.

name: Deuteronomy 15:13
text: When you let him go free from you, you shall not let him go empty:

name: Deuteronomy 15:14
text: you shall furnish him liberally out of your flock, and out of your threshing floor, and out of your winepress; as Yahweh your God has blessed you, you shall give to him.

name: Deuteronomy 15:15
text: You shall remember that you were a bondservant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God redeemed you: therefore I command you this thing today.

name: Deuteronomy 15:16
text: It shall be, if he tells you, "I will not go out from you;" because he loves you and your house, because he is well with you;

name: Deuteronomy 15:17
text: then you shall take an awl, and thrust it through his ear to the door, and he shall be your servant forever. Also to your female servant you shall do likewise.

name: Deuteronomy 15:18
text: It shall not seem hard to you, when you let him go free from you; for to the double of the hire of a hireling has he served you six years: and Yahweh your God will bless you in all that you do.

name: Deuteronomy 15:19
text: All the firstborn males that are born of your herd and of your flock you shall sanctify to Yahweh your God: you shall do no work with the firstborn of your herd, nor shear the firstborn of your flock.

name: Deuteronomy 15:20
text: You shall eat it before Yahweh your God year by year in the place which Yahweh shall choose, you and your household.

name: Deuteronomy 15:21
text: If it has any blemish, is lame or blind, or has any defect whatever, you shall not sacrifice it to Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 15:22
text: You shall eat it within your gates: the unclean and the clean shall eat it alike, as the gazelle, and as the hart.

name: Deuteronomy 15:23
text: Only you shall not eat its blood; you shall pour it out on the ground as water.

name: Deuteronomy 16:1
text: Observe the month of Abib, and keep the Passover to Yahweh your God; for in the month of Abib Yahweh your God brought you forth out of Egypt by night.

name: Deuteronomy 16:2
text: You shall sacrifice the Passover to Yahweh your God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which Yahweh shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there.

name: Deuteronomy 16:3
text: You shall eat no leavened bread with it. You shall eat unleavened bread with it seven days, even the bread of affliction; for you came forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that you may remember the day when you came forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life.

name: Deuteronomy 16:4
text: No yeast shall be seen with you in all your borders seven days; neither shall any of the flesh, which you sacrifice the first day at evening, remain all night until the morning.

name: Deuteronomy 16:5
text: You may not sacrifice the Passover within any of your gates, which Yahweh your God gives you;

name: Deuteronomy 16:6
text: but at the place which Yahweh your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell in, there you shall sacrifice the Passover at evening, at the going down of the sun, at the season that you came forth out of Egypt.

name: Deuteronomy 16:7
text: You shall roast and eat it in the place which Yahweh your God shall choose: and you shall turn in the morning, and go to your tents.

name: Deuteronomy 16:8
text: Six days you shall eat unleavened bread. On the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to Yahweh your God; you shall do no work.

name: Deuteronomy 16:9
text: You shall count for yourselves seven weeks: from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain you shall begin to number seven weeks.

name: Deuteronomy 16:10
text: You shall keep the feast of weeks to Yahweh your God with a tribute of a freewill offering of your hand, which you shall give, according as Yahweh your God blesses you:

name: Deuteronomy 16:11
text: and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates, and the foreigner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are in the midst of you, in the place which Yahweh your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there.

name: Deuteronomy 16:12
text: You shall remember that you were a bondservant in Egypt: and you shall observe and do these statutes.

name: Deuteronomy 16:13
text: You shall keep the feast of tents seven days, after that you have gathered in from your threshing floor and from your winepress:

name: Deuteronomy 16:14
text: and you shall rejoice in your feast, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite, and the foreigner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates.

name: Deuteronomy 16:15
text: You shall keep a feast to Yahweh your God seven days in the place which Yahweh shall choose; because Yahweh your God will bless you in all your increase, and in all the work of your hands, and you shall be altogether joyful.

name: Deuteronomy 16:16
text: Three times in a year shall all your males appear before Yahweh your God in the place which he shall choose: in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tents; and they shall not appear before Yahweh empty:

name: Deuteronomy 16:17
text: every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of Yahweh your God which he has given you.

name: Deuteronomy 16:18
text: You shall make judges and officers in all your gates, which Yahweh your God gives you, according to your tribes; and they shall judge the people with righteous judgment.

name: Deuteronomy 16:19
text: You shall not wrest justice: you shall not respect persons; neither shall you take a bribe; for a bribe does blind the eyes of the wise, and pervert the words of the righteous.

name: Deuteronomy 16:20
text: You shall follow that which is altogether just, that you may live, and inherit the land which Yahweh your God gives you.

name: Deuteronomy 16:21
text: You shall not plant for yourselves an Asherah of any kind of tree beside the altar of Yahweh your God, which you shall make for yourselves.

name: Deuteronomy 16:22
text: Neither shall you set yourself up a pillar; which Yahweh your God hates.

name: Deuteronomy 17:1
text: You shall not sacrifice to Yahweh your God an ox, or a sheep, in which is a blemish, or anything evil; for that is an abomination to Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 17:2
text: If there is found in the midst of you, within any of your gates which Yahweh your God gives you, man or woman, who does that which is evil in the sight of Yahweh your God, in transgressing his covenant,

name: Deuteronomy 17:3
text: and has gone and served other gods, and worshiped them, or the sun, or the moon, or any of the army of the sky, which I have not commanded;

name: Deuteronomy 17:4
text: and it be told you, and you have heard of it, then you shall inquire diligently; and behold, if it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is done in Israel,

name: Deuteronomy 17:5
text: then you shall bring forth that man or that woman, who has done this evil thing, to your gates, even the man or the woman; and you shall stone them to death with stones.

name: Deuteronomy 17:6
text: At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he who is to die be put to death; at the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.

name: Deuteronomy 17:7
text: The hand of the witnesses shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people. So you shall put away the evil from the midst of you.

name: Deuteronomy 17:8
text: If there arises a matter too hard for you in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within your gates; then you shall arise, and go up to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose;

name: Deuteronomy 17:9
text: and you shall come to the priests the Levites, and to the judge who shall be in those days: and you shall inquire; and they shall show you the sentence of judgment.

name: Deuteronomy 17:10
text: You shall do according to the tenor of the sentence which they shall show you from that place which Yahweh shall choose; and you shall observe to do according to all that they shall teach you:

name: Deuteronomy 17:11
text: according to the tenor of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do; you shall not turn aside from the sentence which they shall show you, to the right hand, nor to the left.

name: Deuteronomy 17:12
text: The man who does presumptuously, in not listening to the priest who stands to minister there before Yahweh your God, or to the judge, even that man shall die: and you shall put away the evil from Israel.

name: Deuteronomy 17:13
text: All the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.

name: Deuteronomy 17:14
text: When you have come to the land which Yahweh your God gives you, and shall possess it, and shall dwell therein, and shall say, "I will set a king over me, like all the nations that are around me;"

name: Deuteronomy 17:15
text: you shall surely set him king over yourselves, whom Yahweh your God shall choose: one from among your brothers you shall set king over you; you may not put a foreigner over you, who is not your brother.

name: Deuteronomy 17:16
text: Only he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he may multiply horses; because Yahweh has said to you, "You shall not go back that way again."

name: Deuteronomy 17:17
text: Neither shall he multiply wives to himself, that his heart not turn away: neither shall he greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.

name: Deuteronomy 17:18
text: It shall be, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write him a copy of this law in a book, out of that which is before the priests the Levites:

name: Deuteronomy 17:19
text: and it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all the days of his life; that he may learn to fear Yahweh his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them;

name: Deuteronomy 17:20
text: that his heart not be lifted up above his brothers, and that he not turn aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left: to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his children, in the midst of Israel.

name: Deuteronomy 18:1
text: The priests the Levites, all the tribe of Levi, shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel: they shall eat the offerings of Yahweh made by fire, and his inheritance.

name: Deuteronomy 18:2
text: They shall have no inheritance among their brothers: Yahweh is their inheritance, as he has spoken to them.

name: Deuteronomy 18:3
text: This shall be the priests" due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep, that they shall give to the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.

name: Deuteronomy 18:4
text: The first fruits of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the first of the fleece of your sheep, you shall give him.

name: Deuteronomy 18:5
text: For Yahweh your God has chosen him out of all your tribes, to stand to minister in the name of Yahweh, him and his sons for ever.

name: Deuteronomy 18:6
text: If a Levite comes from any of your gates out of all Israel, where he lives as a foreigner, and comes with all the desire of his soul to the place which Yahweh shall choose;

name: Deuteronomy 18:7
text: then he shall minister in the name of Yahweh his God, as all his brothers the Levites do, who stand there before Yahweh.

name: Deuteronomy 18:8
text: They shall have like portions to eat, besides that which comes of the sale of his patrimony.

name: Deuteronomy 18:9
text: When you have come into the land which Yahweh your God gives you, you shall not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.

name: Deuteronomy 18:10
text: There shall not be found with you anyone who makes his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, one who uses divination, one who practices sorcery, or an enchanter, or a sorcerer,

name: Deuteronomy 18:11
text: or a charmer, or a consulter with a familiar spirit, or a wizard, or a necromancer.

name: Deuteronomy 18:12
text: For whoever does these things is an abomination to Yahweh: and because of these abominations Yahweh your God does drive them out from before you.

name: Deuteronomy 18:13
text: You shall be perfect with Yahweh your God.

name: Deuteronomy 18:14
text: For these nations, that you shall dispossess, listen to those who practice sorcery, and to diviners; but as for you, Yahweh your God has not allowed you so to do.

name: Deuteronomy 18:15
text: Yahweh your God will raise up to you a prophet from the midst of you, of your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him.

name: Deuteronomy 18:16
text: This is according to all that you desired of Yahweh your God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, "Let me not hear again the voice of Yahweh my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I not die."

name: Deuteronomy 18:17
text: Yahweh said to me, "They have well said that which they have spoken.

name: Deuteronomy 18:18
text: I will raise them up a prophet from among their brothers, like you; and I will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak to them all that I shall command him.

name: Deuteronomy 18:19
text: It shall happen, that whoever will not listen to my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.

name: Deuteronomy 18:20
text: But the prophet, who shall speak a word presumptuously in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who shall speak in the name of other gods, that same prophet shall die."

name: Deuteronomy 18:21
text: If you say in your heart, "How shall we know the word which Yahweh has not spoken?"

name: Deuteronomy 18:22
text: when a prophet speaks in the name of Yahweh, if the thing doesn"t follow, nor happen, that is the thing which Yahweh has not spoken: the prophet has spoken it presumptuously, you shall not be afraid of him.

name: Deuteronomy 19:1
text: When Yahweh your God shall cut off the nations, whose land Yahweh your God gives you, and you succeed them, and dwell in their cities, and in their houses;

name: Deuteronomy 19:2
text: you shall set apart three cities for you in the midst of your land, which Yahweh your God gives you to possess it.

name: Deuteronomy 19:3
text: You shall prepare you the way, and divide the borders of your land, which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee there.

name: Deuteronomy 19:4
text: This is the case of the manslayer, that shall flee there and live: whoever kills his neighbor unawares, and didn"t hate him in time past;

name: Deuteronomy 19:5
text: as when a man goes into the forest with his neighbor to chop wood, and his hand fetches a stroke with the axe to cut down the tree, and the head slips from the handle, and lights on his neighbor, so that he dies; he shall flee to one of these cities and live:

name: Deuteronomy 19:6
text: lest the avenger of blood pursue the manslayer, while his heart is hot, and overtake him, because the way is long, and strike him mortally; whereas he was not worthy of death, inasmuch as he didn"t hate him in time past.

name: Deuteronomy 19:7
text: Therefore I command you, saying, You shall set apart three cities for yourselves.

name: Deuteronomy 19:8
text: If Yahweh your God enlarges your border, as he has sworn to your fathers, and gives you all the land which he promised to give to your fathers;

name: Deuteronomy 19:9
text: if you keep all this commandment to do it, which I command you this day, to love Yahweh your God, and to walk ever in his ways; then you shall add three cities more for yourselves, besides these three:

name: Deuteronomy 19:10
text: that innocent blood not be shed in the midst of your land, which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, and so blood be on you.

name: Deuteronomy 19:11
text: But if any man hates his neighbor, and lies in wait for him, and rises up against him, and strikes him mortally so that he dies, and he flees into one of these cities;

name: Deuteronomy 19:12
text: then the elders of his city shall send and bring him there, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.

name: Deuteronomy 19:13
text: Your eye shall not pity him, but you shall put away the innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with you.

name: Deuteronomy 19:14
text: You shall not remove your neighbor"s landmark, which they of old time have set, in your inheritance which you shall inherit, in the land that Yahweh your God gives you to possess it.

name: Deuteronomy 19:15
text: One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin, in any sin that he sins: at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall a matter be established.

name: Deuteronomy 19:16
text: If an unrighteous witness rise up against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing,

name: Deuteronomy 19:17
text: then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges who shall be in those days;

name: Deuteronomy 19:18
text: and the judges shall make diligent inquisition: and, behold, if the witness is a false witness, and has testified falsely against his brother;

name: Deuteronomy 19:19
text: then you shall do to him as he had thought to do to his brother: so you shall put away the evil from the midst of you.

name: Deuteronomy 19:20
text: Those who remain shall hear, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such evil in the midst of you.

name: Deuteronomy 19:21
text: Your eyes shall not pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.

name: Deuteronomy 20:1
text: When you go forth to battle against your enemies, and see horses, chariots, and a people more than you, you shall not be afraid of them; for Yahweh your God is with you, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.

name: Deuteronomy 20:2
text: It shall be, when you draw near to the battle, that the priest shall approach and speak to the people,

name: Deuteronomy 20:3
text: and shall tell them, "Hear, Israel, you draw near this day to battle against your enemies: don"t let your heart faint; don"t be afraid, nor tremble, neither be scared of them;

name: Deuteronomy 20:4
text: for Yahweh your God is he who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you."

name: Deuteronomy 20:5
text: The officers shall speak to the people, saying, "What man is there who has built a new house, and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man dedicate it.

name: Deuteronomy 20:6
text: What man is there who has planted a vineyard, and has not used its fruit? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man use its fruit.

name: Deuteronomy 20:7
text: What man is there who has pledged to be married a wife, and has not taken her? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man take her."

name: Deuteronomy 20:8
text: The officers shall speak further to the people, and they shall say, "What man is there who is fearful and fainthearted? Let him go and return to his house, lest his brother"s heart melt as his heart."

name: Deuteronomy 20:9
text: It shall be, when the officers have made an end of speaking to the people, that they shall appoint captains of armies at the head of the people.

name: Deuteronomy 20:10
text: When you draw near to a city to fight against it, then proclaim peace to it.

name: Deuteronomy 20:11
text: It shall be, if it makes you answer of peace, and opens to you, then it shall be, that all the people who are found therein shall become tributary to you, and shall serve you.

name: Deuteronomy 20:12
text: If it will make no peace with you, but will make war against you, then you shall besiege it:

name: Deuteronomy 20:13
text: and when Yahweh your God delivers it into your hand, you shall strike every male of it with the edge of the sword:

name: Deuteronomy 20:14
text: but the women, and the little ones, and the livestock, and all that is in the city, even all its spoil, you shall take for a prey to yourself; and you shall eat the spoil of your enemies, which Yahweh your God has given you.

name: Deuteronomy 20:15
text: Thus you shall do to all the cities which are very far off from you, which are not of the cities of these nations.

name: Deuteronomy 20:16
text: But of the cities of these peoples, that Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, you shall save alive nothing that breathes;

name: Deuteronomy 20:17
